events.title: Thai police go undercover as lion dancers to nab a serial burglar
events.summary: Thai police say they've caught an elusive serial burglar by going undercover as lion dancers at a temple fair

events.title: Guns, fashionable clothes and death threats: How gangs in Haiti ensnare children
events.summary: A 16-year-old Haitian boy has been talking about how he was lured into working for a criminal gang but then threatened with death when he said he would not fight against the police.

events.title: World News in Brief: UN humanitarian chief visits South Sudan, shelter fire risks in Gaza, West Bank violence
events.summary: The UN Emergency Relief Coordinator arrived in South Sudan on Friday to visit one of the most under-reported humanitarian crises in the world, as clashes between government and opposition forces continue in Jonglei state.

events.title: UN report exposes torture, rape in Southeast Asia’s multi-billion-dollar scam centres
events.summary: A sprawling online scam industry worth an estimated tens of billions of dollars a year is being powered by trafficked workers subjected to torture, sexual abuse and forced labour inside heavily guarded compounds in Southeast Asia, a new UN human rights report has found.

events.title: Science-led governance of AI can help power sustainable development: Guterres
events.summary: UN Secretary-General António Guterres highlighted the key role science has in international governance of artificial intelligence during an event on Friday held on the margins of the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi, India.

events.title: Ukraine’s women at breaking point after four years of war as attacks on energy, healthcare continue – UN humanitarians
events.summary: Four years into Russia’s full-scale invasion, millions in Ukraine struggle to keep the lights on and heat their homes, with the crisis taking a particular toll on women, humanitarians warned on Friday.

events.title: ‘Alarming increase’ in recruitment of children into gangs in Haiti
events.summary: There has been an “alarming increase” in the number of children being recruited into gangs in Haiti with “devastating consequences” for children, families and society as a whole, the UN reported on Friday.

events.title: UNICEF calls for release of children detained during Iran protests
events.summary: The UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF) has called for the immediate release of all children detained during the recent public unrest in Iran, expressing deep concern that minors arrested in connection with the protests remain behind bars.

events.title: World News in Brief: Conflict deepens hunger crisis in South Sudan, restrictions hinder aid delivery in Gaza, UN child rights envoy concludes first visit to Syria
events.summary: The UN World Food Programme (WFP) is scaling up its emergency response in South Sudan’s Jonglei state, where escalating conflict has displaced hundreds of thousands of people and pushed hunger to critical levels.

events.title: ‘No corner of Sudan is safe’: UN officials warn of famine and atrocities as war intensifies
events.summary: Nearly three years into Sudan’s war, violence is intensifying, famine conditions are looming in parts of the country, and civilians remain trapped between shifting front lines, senior UN political and humanitarian officials told the Security Council on Thursday, warning that the risk of further mass atrocities remains alarmingly high.

events.title: UN rights chief: AI must be based on inclusivity, accountability and global standards
events.summary: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk, has warned that without urgent guardrails, AI risks deepening inequality, amplifying bias and fuelling real-world harm.

events.title: Security Council LIVE: Sudan in focus amid genocide warnings in Darfur
events.summary: The UN Security Council meets this morning to discuss Sudan as the war nears its third year, with fighting intensifying across multiple regions and civilians facing deepening humanitarian catastrophe. Senior UN political and humanitarian officials are expected to brief ministers on a conflict marked by shifting front lines, advanced weaponry and widespread displacement. The meeting comes amid fresh warnings that atrocities in Darfur, including acts bearing the “hallmarks of genocide” in El Fasher, signal a dangerous escalation. Follow the live coverage below, UN News App users click here.

events.title: Fears of ethnic cleansing in Gaza and the West Bank: UN rights report
events.summary: Increased Israeli attacks and the forced transfer of Palestinians have sparked concern over ethnic cleansing in the Gaza Strip and the West Bank, the UN human rights office, OHCHR, said in a report issued on Thursday.

events.title: Sudan: ‘Hallmarks of genocide’ found in El Fasher, UN investigators detail mass killings and ethnic targeting
events.summary: The Rapid Support Forces (RSF) carried out ethnically targeted killings, widespread sexual violence and enforced disappearances during their late-October takeover of El Fasher in Sudan’s Darfur region — acts that a UN fact-finding mission said show “hallmarks of genocide” against the Zaghawa and Fur communities and signal an ongoing risk of further atrocities.

events.title: From India, Guterres calls for $3 billion fund to ensure AI benefits all
events.summary: The future of artificial intelligence “cannot be decided by a handful of countries or left to the whims of a few billionaires,” the UN Secretary-General told the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi on Thursday, calling for a global fund to help developing nations to better access these technologies.

events.title: World News in Brief: Guterres calls for fair swtich to clean energy, Ramadan in Gaza, escalating violence and displacement in South Sudan
events.summary: The world has “entered the age of clean energy” and renewables are now the cheapest, fastest and safest source of new electricity almost everywhere, UN Secretary-General António Guterres said in a video message to the International Energy Agency ministerial meeting in Paris on Wednesday.

events.title: Security Council LIVE: Situation in the Middle East
events.summary: The UN Security Council meets at 3 PM (New York time) on Wednesday to discuss the situation in the Middle East, with rising tensions in the occupied West Bank expected to dominate the session. Under-Secretary-General for Political Affairs Rosemary DiCarlo is scheduled to brief members. The meeting follows recent Israeli cabinet decisions expanding control in Areas A, B and C of the West Bank. Secretary-General António Guterres has warned that the current trajectory is “eroding the prospect” of a two-State solution. Follow the live coverage below, UN News App users click here.

events.title: Decades of gains overshadowed as Asia-Pacific falls behind on sustainable development targets
events.summary: Climate inaction, biodiversity loss and rising emissions are pushing Asia and the Pacific further off course on the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), with the region set to miss nearly nine out of ten targets by 2030, the United Nations has warned.

events.title: Grain ATMs and hunger maps: AI innovations spotlighted at UN agency showcase in India
events.summary: Artificial intelligence solutions that transform the way food assistance reaches people facing hunger were on display during an exhibition at an AI meeting this week in New Delhi, India.

events.title: Floods, drought and insecurity drive acute hunger for 7.5 million in Pakistan
events.summary: After a year that saw heavy monsoon floods, prolonged drought and dry spells, and a surge in violence, 7.5 million people in Pakistan face high levels of food insecurity and malnutrition according to a report from the global hunger monitor.

events.title: Artists face steep income decline due to AI, UNESCO finds
events.summary: Creators worldwide are facing mounting financial pressures as rapid advances in digital technologies and artificial intelligence continue to transform the cultural and creative industries, according to a new global report released by the UN culture agency, UNESCO, on Wednesday.

events.title: Sudan: Rights chief alarmed after at least 57 killed in drone attacks in two days
events.summary: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights called on Wednesday for warring parties in Sudan to take urgent steps to protect civilians after at least 57 people were killed in separate drone strikes over two days this week.

events.title: UN Libya envoy warns Security Council political deadlock threatens state unity
events.summary: Libya’s prolonged political stalemate, worsening economic conditions and an emerging split within the judiciary pose mounting risks to the country’s unity, the UN’s top envoy for the country, Hanna Serwaa Tetteh, told the Security Council on Wednesday.

events.title: World News in Brief: Madagascar cyclone response, Gaza medical evacuations, remembering civil rights icon Jesse Jackson
events.summary: At least 52 people have died after Tropical Cyclone Gezani made landfall on the eastern coast of Madagascar on 10 February, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said on Tuesday, citing the authorities.

events.title: Ramadan in Gaza: Deprivation, high prices and the hardships of displacement
events.summary: Palestinian Walid Al-Assi was playing with his young granddaughter this week, promising to take her to the market in Gaza City with the arrival of the holy month of Ramadan as his family had done before the Israel-Hamas war, but now circumstances had changed.

events.title: Migrants and refugees in Libya subjected to ‘systematic’ abuse: UN report
events.summary: Migrants, refugees and asylum-seekers in Libya are enduring ruthless and systematic human rights violations, including killings, torture, sexual violence and trafficking, according to a new report published today by the UN human rights office, OHCHR.

events.title: Humanitarian access to Gaza still insufficient for relief and rebuilding: UN development chief
events.summary: The UN has the funds and capacity to scale up relief and reconstruction operations in Gaza but does not have the necessary access to carry out these vital tasks, Alexander De Croo, the head of the UN Development Programme (UNDP), told journalists on Tuesday.

events.title: Epstein files: ‘No one is too wealthy or too powerful to be above the law’; rights experts demand accountability

events.summary: King Charles III took the unusual step of personally signing his statement following the arrest of his brother,  Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor.

events.title: In the West Bank, new Israeli regulations stoke Palestinian fears of annexation
events.summary: In the Palestinian city of Hebron fears about new Israeli regulations on land registration and tightening control are stoking fears of annexation.

events.title: Robots and Draco Malfoy: How China is celebrating the Year of the Horse
events.summary: BEIJING — The Lunar New Year is coming, and China is on the move

events.title: Why a dart frog poison believed to have killed Alexei Navalny points to the Kremlin
events.summary: Precise, deniable and, in Russia’s case, grimly familiar.

events.title: One of Gaza's surviving radio stations returns to the airwaves after two years of war
events.summary: Inside a completely destroyed building in Gaza City, five staff members returned to bring life back to Zaman FM after two years of war. The station stays on air for three to four hours a day, as presenters warn residents about unexploded ordnance hidden in the streets.

events.title: The Austrian bobsled team crashes at the Winter Games
events.summary: The Austrian bobsled team crashed at the Winter Games while competing in Run 2 of the four-man bobsled event. Pilot Jakob Mandlbauer received medical treatment. NBC News' Gadi Schwartz reports on the outcome of the bobsled accident. Watch the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics on NBC and streaming on Peacock.

events.title: Several killed after truck explosion in Chile
events.summary: Several people were killed and others injured after a truck transporting liquified gas overturned and exploded in Santiago, Chile. NBC News' George Solis reports on the disaster.

events.title: What to know about Elon Musk and China with Tesla's massive 'Gigafactory' in Shanghai
events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: Israeli settlers kill 19-year-old Palestinian-American, officials and witnesses say
events.summary: MUKHMAS, West Bank — Israeli settlers in the occupied West Bank shot and killed a Palestinian-American during an attack on a village, the Palestinian Health Ministry and a witness said Thursday

events.title: British government considers removing former Prince Andrew from the royal line of succession
events.summary: The British government is considering formally removing Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor from the royal line of succession once the police investigation into allegations of misconduct in public office has concluded, a source familiar with the deliberations told NBC News

events.title: India's AI summit draws global leaders, big pledges and some chaos
events.summary: As the U.S. and China battle to dominate artificial intelligence, India has attempted to highlight that there are other pathways to navigate the silicon surge.

events.title: What Trump's first Board of Peace summit signals about Gaza's future
events.summary: Billions of dollars earmarked for reconstruction and the promise of an international stabilization force for the destroyed Gaza Strip.

events.title: Possible next steps after the arrest of former Prince Andrew
events.summary: LONDON — Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor may have been released from custody, but his legal saga is not over

events.title: Former Prince Andrew arrested following Epstein files revelations
events.summary: Police arrested Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor on Thursday following weeks of revelations over the former prince's friendship and dealings with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: How the Andrew-Epstein saga plunged Britain's royals into a yearslong crisis
events.summary: LONDON — The arrest of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor on suspicion of misconduct in public office is the latest development in a yearslong saga over his dealings with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, which has plunged the British monarchy into its biggest crisis in decades

events.title: Trump vows $10 billion from U.S. for his Board of Peace as he leans into global role
events.summary: President Donald Trump's Board of Peace gathered in Washington on Thursday for its long-awaited first meeting, with the next stage of the fragile ceasefire in Gaza in focus.

events.title: Ex-South Korean president found guilty of insurrection over martial law order
events.summary: Yoon Suk Yeol, the impeached former president of South Korea, was found guilty of insurrection and sentenced to life in prison on Thursday over his failed attempt to impose martial law on the U.S. ally

events.title: U.S. military pushes more weaponry into the Middle East for possible strikes on Iran
events.summary: WASHINGTON — The Defense Department is sending a large array of additional weaponry to the Middle East, including more warships, air defenses and submarines, in preparation for a possible military strike on Iran if President Donald Trump makes that decision, according to U.S. officials and information from public tracking.

events.title: Epstein files revelations spark new European police probes
events.summary: The files related to Jeffrey Epstein released by the Department of Justice have led to new police investigations in Paris and London.

events.title: Ukraine officials to boycott Paralympics for letting Russians compete under their flag
events.summary: Ukraine said Wednesday that its officials will not attend the Winter Paralympics next month over organizers’ decision to allow a handful of Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete under their flags

events.title: 'Difficult' peace talks spotlight Putin's chief negotiator and Ukraine antagonist
events.summary: Russia and Ukraine don’t agree on much, but both sides left the latest round of U.S.-led peace talks Wednesday describing the negotiations as “difficult.”Moscow — and increasingly President Donald Trump — have blamed Ukraine for the absence of a deal, while Kyiv argues it is instead the Kremlin that is stalling

events.title: U.S. and Iran tout progress in nuclear talks as supreme leader warns Trump over military buildup
events.summary: The United States and Iran have reached an understanding on the “guiding principles” in nuclear talks, Tehran’s foreign minister said Tuesday, though he cautioned that work still needs to be done to reach an agreement and head off the threat of an American military attack.“I believe we made good progress,” said Abbas Araghchi, the head of the Iranian delegation in Geneva.

events.title: Warmer words but relations remain frosty between the U.S. and its old friends in Europe
events.summary: From Munich to Bratislava and Budapest

events.title: British airline bans two 'disruptive' passengers for life after midair brawl
events.summary: British airline Jet2 announced that it banned two travelers for life after they started brawling on a flight bound for Manchester, England, on Thursday, resulting in its diversion
